Detailed Description

A micro mvc framework for PHP

Author:
Mateo Murphy The Micro class is root class and entry point of a Micro application. It can be used as-is or subclassed to override certain behaviors.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Micro::__construct ( $  base_url,
$  root_path = null 
)

Constructor

Parameters:
string $base_url The base url of the application.
string $root_path The root path of the application, which is the directory of the file containing the app. If no value is given, it's assumed that the code is running in the same directory as this file.

Member Function Documentation

Micro::getControllerNames (  ) 

Returns an array containing the names of all the controller for the application, which are all declared classes that have MicroController as a parent

Returns:
array

Micro::getHelper (  ) 

Returns either the first helper object defined by the app, which is any class that subclasses MicroHelper, or the standard helper.

Returns:
MicroHelper

Micro::go ( $  url,
$  controllers = null,
$  helper = null 
)

Processes the current request by finding a controller whose route matches the given URL and outputting the result

Parameters:
string $url The URL of the request
array $controllers An array containing the names of the controllers to use to process the request. This isn't usually neccesary, but there may be times when you don't want all subclasses of MicroController present in the system to be used.
MicroHelper $helper The helper object to use.
Returns:
bool

Micro::onError ( $  renderer,
$  exception 
)

This method is called when an unhandled exception occus somewhere in the code. By default it will show a 500 error page.

Parameters:
Exception $exception

Micro::beforeDispatch ( $  controller  ) 

This method is called before the request is dispatched to the controller, allowing subclasses to perform setup actions on the controller.

Parameters:
MicroController $controller The controller handling the request

Micro::beforeRender ( $  renderer  ) 

This method is called before the rendere outputs to the browser, allowing subclasses to modify the output.

Parameters:
MicroRenderer $renderer
